https://prez.dev/description.@value: A categorization of disciplines or topics that the broad field of Earth science can be subdivided into, i.e. a listing of the Fields of Research, or subjects, to which a geoscience dataset, publication, observation/activity, or entity pertains. The vocabulary also contains relevant disciplines that intersect with the various Earth science fields, such as biological sciences and built environment and design, as well as entries related to collection and heritage management. Notations included are those from the 2020 ANZSRC listing (see History Note) or in common use in the geoscience community.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#defi.@value: The study of climates prior to the period of instrumental records, and of the causes of their variation, on either a local, regional or worldwide basis. It uses a variety of proxy methods from the Earth and life sciences to obtain data preserved within rocks, sediments, ice sheets, tree rings, corals, shells, and microfossils to determine the past states of the Earth's various climate regions and its atmospheric system.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#hist.@value: From the Fields of Research vocabulary from the Australian and New Zealand Standard Research Classification (ANZSRC, 2020). Definition adapted from Glossary of geology (5th edition revised; Neuendorf et al., 2011) and Wikipedia.

https://prez.dev/description.@value: The study of climates prior to the period of instrumental records, and of the causes of their variation, on either a local, regional or worldwide basis. It uses a variety of proxy methods from the Earth and life sciences to obtain data preserved within rocks, sediments, ice sheets, tree rings, corals, shells, and microfossils to determine the past states of the Earth's various climate regions and its atmospheric system.
The reconstruction of past environments and their climates within regions or across regions, based on the sediments, soils, strata, and associated biological remains.
